sen.j: 狭穂姫命（さほひめのみこと、生年不詳 - 垂仁天皇5年（紀元前24年）10月没）とは、記紀に伝えられる垂仁天皇の最初の皇后（垂仁天皇2年（紀元前28年）2月9日立后）。
sen.e: Sahohime no mikoto (狭穂姫命: year of birth unknown - the tenth month of the fifth year of Emperor Suinin's reign (B.C, 24)) was the first documented Empress of Emperor Suinin (she was ascended to be Empress on the ninth day of the second month of the second year of Emperor Suinin's reign (B.C, 28).
sen.cmt: 名前の漢字表記を加えました。 垂仁天皇5年（紀元前24年）10月→定訳不明：the tenth month of the fifth year of Emperor Suinin's reignとしました。 垂仁天皇2年（紀元前28年）2月9日→定訳不明：the ninth day of the second month of the second year of Emperor Suinin's reignとしました。
sen.e: Sahohime no mikoto (狭穂姫命: year of birth unknown - the tenth month of the fifth year of Emperor Suinin's reign (24 B.C.)) was the first documented Empress of Emperor Suinin (she became the Empress on the ninth day of the second month of the second year of Emperor Suinin's reign (28 B.C.).
sen.cmt: B.C.は数字の後に付けるのが一般的と認識しており、そのようにした。She was ascended to be Empressをshe became the Empressに変更。
sen.e: Empress Sahohime no mikoto (year of birth unknown - November, 25 B.C.) was the first wife of Emperor Suinin (she became Empress on March 29, 28 B.C.), and she is mentioned in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: the tenth month of the fifth year of Emperor Suinin's reign (24 B.C.)→November, 25 B.C.the ninth day of the second month of the second year of Emperor Suinin's reign (28 B.C.).→March 29, 28 B.C.「記紀に伝えられる」の訳漏れ対応

sen.j: 『古事記』において最も物語性の高いとされる、垂仁天皇条の「狭穂毘古の叛乱」のヒロイン。
sen.e: She was the heroine of the tale'Rebellion of Sahohiko no mikoto,' which is said to be the most romantic story in all the episodes compiled in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
She was the heroine of the tale 'Rebellion of Sahohiko no mikoto,' which is said to be the most romantic story in all the episodes compiled in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
sen.cmt: the tale'Rebellion ・・・ となっているのを the tale 'Rebellion ・・・ と間にスペースを挿入。
sen.e: She was the heroine of the tale 'Rebellion of Sahohiko no mikoto,' which is said to be the most romantic story in all the episodes compiled in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 兄の狭穂彦王（沙本毘古）の起した叛乱に殉じる。
sen.e: She was involved and died in the rebellion provoked by her elder brother Sahohiko no miko (狭穂彦王: also written as 沙本毘古).
sen.cmt: 名前の漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: She was involved and died in the rebellion provoked by her elder brother Sahohiko no miko (狭穂彦王: also written as 沙本毘古).
She was involved and died in the rebellion provoked by her elder brother Sahohiko no miko (狭穂彦王: also written as 沙本毘古).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』では狭穂姫命、『古事記』では沙本毘売命、または佐波遅比売命。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her name was written as 狭穂姫命, while in the Kojiki, her name was expressed as 沙本毘売命 or 佐波遅比売命 (in the latter two cases the name is also pronounced as Sahohime no mikoto).
sen.cmt: 沙本毘売命、または佐波遅比売命→沙本毘売命 or 佐波遅比売命 (in the latter two cases the name is also pronounced as Sahohime no mikoto)と名前漢字表記および（）内に読みの説明を加えました。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her name is written as 狭穂姫命, while in the Kojiki, her name is expressed as 沙本毘売命 or 佐波遅比売命 (in the latter two cases the name is also pronounced as Sahohime no mikoto).

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her name is written as 狭穂姫命, while in the Kojiki, her name is expressed as 沙本毘売命 or 佐波遅比売命 (in the latter two cases the name is also pronounced as Sahohime no mikoto).

sen.j: 父は彦坐王（開化天皇の子）、母は沙本之大闇見戸売（春日建国勝戸売の女）。
sen.e: His father was Hikoimasu no miko (Emperor Kaika's son) and her mother was Sahonookuramitome (Kasuga tatekuni katsutome's daughter).
sen.cmt: 沙本之大闇見戸売→Sahonookuramitome 音読みすると長くなり読み辛そうです。名前の表記法をご検討ください。 春日建国勝戸売→Kasuga tatekuni katsutome 音読みすると長くなり読み辛そうです。名前の表記法をご検討ください。
sen.e: His father was Hikoimasu no miko (Emperor Kaika's son) and her mother was Sahonookuramitome (Kasuga tatekuni katsutome's daughter).
His father was Hikoimasu no miko (Emperor Kaika's son) and her mother was Sahonookuramitome (Kasuga tatekuni katsutome's daughter).

sen.j: 同母の兄弟は日下部連・甲斐国造の祖狭穂彦王、若狭耳別の祖室毘古王、葛野別・近淡海蚊野別の祖袁邪本王。
sen.e: Her brothers by the same mother were Sahohiko no miko, the ancestor of Kusakabe no muraji (one of the most privileged surname given to local lords during the Yamato Dynasty) and Kainokuni no miyatsuko (local lord of Kai Province); Murobiko no miko, the ancestor of Wakasa no mimi no wake; and Ogiho no okimi, the ancestor of Kazuno no wake and Chikatsuomi no kano no wake.
sen.cmt: 同母の兄弟→brothers by the same motherとしました。 日下部連→Kusakabe no muraji (one of the most privileged surname given to local lords during the Yamato Dynasty) と（）内に説明を加えました。 甲斐国造→Kainokuni no miyatsuko (local lord of Kai Province)と（）内に説明を加えました。 近淡海蚊野別→Omi no kanono wakeとも言うようです。
sen.e: Her brothers by the same mother were Sahohiko no miko, the ancestor of Kusakabe no muraji (one of the most privileged surname given to local lords during the Yamato Dynasty) and Kainokuni no miyatsuko (local lord of Kai Province); Murobiko no miko, the ancestor of Wakasa no mimi no wake; and Ogiho no okimi, the ancestor of Kazuno no wake and Chikatsuomi no kano no wake.

Her brothers by the same mother were Sahohiko no miko, the ancestor of Kusakabe no muraji (one of the most privileged surname given to local lords during the Yamato Dynasty) and Kainokuni no miyatsuko (local lord of Kai Province); Murobiko no miko, the ancestor of Wakasa no mimi no wake; and Ogiho no okimi, the ancestor of Kazuno no wake and Chikatsuomi no kano no wake.

sen.j: 子に誉津別命（本牟智和気御子）がある。
sen.e: Homutsuwake no mikoto (誉津別命: also written as 本牟智和気御子) was her son.
Homutsuwake no mikoto (誉津別命: also written as 本牟智和気御子) was her son.
Homutsuwake no mikoto (誉津別命: also written as 本牟智和気御子) was her son.

sen.j: ちなみに垂仁天皇の次の皇后である日葉酢媛命は彦坐王の子である丹波道主王の女であり、姪に当たる。
sen.e: Hibasuhime, the next Empress of Emperor Suinin, was the daughter of Hikoimasu no miko's son Tanbanomichinoshi no kami, and the niece of Sahohime no mikoto.
Hibasuhime, the next Empress of Emperor Suinin, was a daughter of Hikoimasu no miko's son Tanbanomichinoshi no kami, and a niece of Sahohime no mikoto.
sen.cmt: daughter nieceにつける冠詞をthe からaに変更
sen.e: Hibasuhime, the next Empress of Emperor Suinin, was a daughter of Hikoimasu no miko's son Tanbanomichinoshi no kami, and a niece of Sahohime no mikoto.

sen.j: 春の女神で同名の佐保姫とは無関係。
sen.e: She has the same name as the goddess of spring Sahohime (written as 佐保姫), but she has nothing to do with the goddess.
She has the same name as the goddess of spring Sahohime (written as 佐保姫), but she has nothing to do with the goddess.
She has the same name as the goddess of spring Sahohime (written as 佐保姫), but she has nothing to do with the goddess.

sen.j: 佐保姫の項、参照。
sen.e: See to the section of 'Saho-hime'.
See the section of 'Saho-hime.'
sen.cmt: See to からto を除去。 ピリオドを引用符の内側に収容。
sen.e: See the section of 'Saho-hime.'

sen.j: 狭穂毘古の叛乱
sen.e: Rebellion of Sahohiko no miko
Rebellion of Sahohiko no miko
Rebellion of Sahohiko no miko

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Outline of the story
Outline of the story
Outline of the story

sen.j: 以下は『古事記』におけるあらすじ。
sen.e: The following outline is based on the story compiled in the Kojiki.
The following outline is based on the story compiled in the Kojiki.
The following outline is based on the story compiled in the Kojiki.

sen.j: 名前の表記は、『古事記』に従う。
sen.e: The names are written following the writings in the Kojiki.
The names are written following the writings in the Kojiki.
The names are written following the writings in the Kojiki.

sen.j: 狭穂毘売は垂仁天皇の皇后となっていた。
sen.e: Sahohime was the Empress of Emperor Suinin.
Sahohime was the Empress of Emperor Suinin.
Sahohime was the Empress of Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: ところがある日、兄の狭穂毘古に「お前は夫と私どちらが愛おしいか」と尋ねられて「兄のほうが愛おしい」と答えたところ、短刀を渡され天皇を暗殺するように言われる。
sen.e: However, one day his elder brother Sahohiko no miko asked her, '[w]hich of us do you love more, your husband or me?,' and when she answered, ' brother, I love you more,' he handed a knife and ordered her to assassinate the Emperor.

However, one day his elder brother Sahohiko no miko asked her, 'which of us do you love more, your husband or me?,' and when she answered, ' brother, I love you more,' he handed a knife and ordered her to assassinate the Emperor.
sen.cmt: '[w]hich of usから鍵括弧を除去
sen.e: However, one day his elder brother Sahohiko no miko asked her, 'which of us do you love more, your husband or me?,' and when she answered, ' brother, I love you more,' he handed a knife and ordered her to assassinate the Emperor.

sen.j: 妻を心から愛している天皇は何の疑問も抱かず姫の膝枕で眠りにつき、姫は三度短刀を振りかざすが夫不憫さに耐えられず涙をこぼしてしまう。
sen.e: When the Emperor, who was deeply in love with her, fell a sleep on the Empress's lap peacefully, the Empress brandished the knife over his body, but she could not help dropping tears, feeling too pity for him.

When the Emperor, who was deeply in love with her, fell a sleep on the Empress's lap peacefully, the Empress brandished the knife over his body, but she could not help dropping tears, feeling too pity for him.

When the Emperor, who was deeply in love with her, fell a sleep on the Empress's lap peacefully, the Empress brandished the knife over his body, but she could not help dropping tears, feeling too pity for him.

sen.j: 目が覚めた天皇から、夢の中で「錦色の小蛇が私の首に巻きつき、佐保の方角から雨雲が起こり私の頬に雨がかかった。」
sen.e: The Emperor, who wake up, told her about what he dreamed; 'a colorful and brilliant small snake wounded itself around my neck and then a rain cloud proceeding from the direction of Saho fell rain drops on my cheeks.'
sen.cmt: 錦色→定訳不明：colorful and brilliantとしました。
sen.e: The Emperor woke up and told her about what he had dreamed; 'a colorful and brilliant small snake wound around my neck and then a rain cloud approached from the direction of Saho to fall rain drops on my cheeks.'
sen.cmt: wake upをwoke upに変更、その他時制の調整
sen.e: The Emperor woke up and told her about what he had dreamed; 'a colorful and brilliant small snake wound around my neck and then a rain cloud approached from the direction of Saho to fall rain drops on my cheeks.'

sen.j: これはどういう意味だろうと言われ、狭穂毘売は暗殺未遂の顛末を述べた後兄の元へ逃れてしまった。
sen.e: And when he asked her opinion on what his dream meant, she ran away to her brother after she confessed the Emperor the assassination attempt, which she could not carry out.
And when he asked her opinion on what his dream meant, she ran away to her brother after she confessed the Emperor the assassination attempt.
sen.cmt: , which she could not carry outの部分を削除（既にattemptと記述しているので未遂であることは明白）。
sen.e: And when he asked her opinion on what his dream meant, she ran away to her brother after she confessed the Emperor the assassination attempt.

sen.j: 反逆者は討伐せねばならないが、天皇は姫を深く愛しており、姫の腹には天皇の子がすくすくと育っていた。
sen.e: Although the Emperor had to subdue the traitors, he loved her deeply and, in addition, she was carrying his son, who was growing steadily.
Although the Emperor had to subdue the traitors, he loved her deeply and, in addition, she was expecting his son, who was growing steadily.
sen.cmt: was carryingを was expectingに変更
sen.e: Although the Emperor had to subdue the traitors, he loved her deeply and, in addition, she was expecting his son, who was growing steadily.

sen.j: 姫も息子を道連れにするのが忍びなく天皇に息子を引き取るように頼んだ。
sen.e: As she also felt very sorry for involving his son, she asked the Emperor to take charge of their son.
As she also felt very sorry for involving his son, she asked the Emperor to take care of the son.
sen.cmt: take charge of their sonをtake care of the sonに変更。
sen.e: As she also felt very sorry for involving his son, she asked the Emperor to take care of the son.

sen.j: 天皇は敏捷な兵士を差し向けて息子を渡しに来た姫を奪還させようとするが、姫の決意は固かった。
sen.e: The Emperor sent agile soldiers to recapture the Empress who came out to hand over his son to the soldiers, however, her resolution was firm.
The Emperor sent agile soldiers to recapture the Empress who came out to hand over his son to the soldiers, however, her resolution was firm.
The Emperor sent agile soldiers to recapture the Empress who came out to hand over his son to the soldiers, however, her resolution was firm.

sen.j: 髪は剃りあげて鬘にし腕輪の糸は切り目を入れてあった。
sen.e: She shaved up her head to make a mannish topknot, and made a notch on the thread of her bracelets.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: She had shaved her hair on the head to make a mannish topknot, and had made a notch on the thread of her bracelets.
sen.cmt: She shaved up her head の部分の表現の見直し、時制の調整。
sen.e: She had shaved her hair on the head to make a mannish topknot, and had made a notch on the thread of her bracelets.

sen.j: 衣装も酒で腐らせて兵士が触れるそばから破けてしまったため姫の奪還は叶わない。
sen.e: Her dress, which was also corroded by the effect of sake, was easily torn with a single touch of the soldiers and made her even more elusive, and it was, therefore, difficult for the soldiers to catch her.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Her dress, which had been soaked with sake, was decayed due to the effect of sake so that it was easily torn up when touched by the soldiers; this made it difficult for the soldiers to catch her.
Her dress, which had been soaked with sake, was decayed due to the effect of sake so that it was easily torn up when touched by the soldiers; this made it difficult for the soldiers to catch her.

sen.j: 天皇が「この子の名はどうしたらよいか」と尋ねると、姫は「火の中で産んだのですから、名は本牟智和気御子とつけたらよいでしょう」と申し上げた。
sen.e: When the Emperor asked, 'what shall I do with the name of our son?' she replied, 'as I delivered him in the flames, you may call him Homuchiwake no miko (prince born through the flames)?'
sen.cmt: 本牟智和気御子→Homuchiwake no miko (prince born through the flames)と（）内に名前の意味(推測）を入れました。
sen.e: When the Emperor asked, 'what shall I do with the name of our son?' she replied, 'as I delivered him in the flames, you may call him Homuchiwake no miko (prince born through the flames)?'
When the Emperor asked, 'what shall I do with the name of our son?' she replied, 'as I delivered him in the flames, you may call him Homuchiwake no miko (prince born through the flames).'

sen.j: また天皇が「お前が結んだ下紐は、誰が解いてくれるのか」と尋ねると、姫は「旦波比古多多須美知能宇斯王に兄比売と弟比売という姉妹がいます。」と応えた。
sen.e: The Emperor continued asking, 'who on earth will untie the strings of my under-kilt you tied?' and she answered, 'Tanihanohikotatasumichino-ushinoo has two daughters called Ehime and Otohime, respectively.
sen.cmt: 下紐→定訳不明：under-kilt 旦波比古多多須美知能宇斯王→Tanihanohikotatasumichino-ushinoo音読みすると長くなり読み辛そうです。
sen.e: The Emperor continued asking, 'who on earth will untie the strings of my under-kilt you tied?' and she answered, 'Tanihanohikotatasumichino-ushinoo has two daughters called Ehime and Otohime, respectively.

The Emperor continued asking, 'who on earth will untie the strings of my under-kilt you tied?' and she answered, 'Tanihanohikotatasumichino-ushinoo has two daughters called Ehime and Otohime, respectively.'
sen.cmt: 原文に」を、、および英文に'を付けました。「と応えた。」を原文に追加しました。

sen.j: 「彼女らは忠誠な民です。」
sen.e: These sisters are faithful people.
These sisters are faithful people.
These sisters are faithful people.'
sen.cmt: 原文を「」で、および英文を''で囲みました。

sen.j: 「故に二人をお召しになるのがよいでしょう」と申し上げた。
sen.e: And she said to him '[y]ou'd better invite them for your console.'
And she said to him 'you should invite them for your console.'
sen.cmt: '[y]ou'd better invite them を you should invite them に変更
sen.e: And she said to him 'you should invite them for your console.'

sen.j: そうして炎に包まれた稲城の中で、狭穂毘売は兄に殉じてしまった。
sen.e: Then, she followed his elder brother to death at the Inagi Castle covered by the roaring flames.
Then, she followed his elder brother to death at the Inagi Castle covered by the roaring flames.
Then, she followed his elder brother to death at the Inagi Castle covered by the roaring flames.
